title: Jonathan Davies riding the rollercoaster of Welsh rugby but admits he 'feared the worst' over injury setback
text:
Jonathan Davies has declared himself ready for a once-in-a-lifetime World Cup battle with South Africa despite admitting he is not 100 per cent fit. The Wales centre has been named in Warren Gatland’s side for Sunday’s crunch Yokohama semi-final as he continues to battle a troublesome left knee problem that he initially feared was a cruciate knee ligament injury.

Davies, 31, was a late withdrawal from his team’s quarter-final victory over France with the problem and has faced a race to be ready for the Springboks.

description: Jonathan Davies has declared himself ready for a once-in-a-lifetime World Cup battle with South Africa despite admitting he is not 100 per cent fit.
